data.title: Try the Turkish Pizza
data.text: I ordered the Turkish Pizza (Feta Cheese Pide) burst of great flavor. Ummmm ummmm delicious. In addition you're served warm bread with a red dipping sauce delicious!

data.title: Wonderful food
data.text: The Turkish food was excellent. Best Baklava in Triangle.  Got take out for family members who were unable to come with us.

data.title: This hidden gem won't be a secret for much longer!
data.text:
By far, the most authentic Turkish meal I've had in NC.

The waiters here are charming, professional and are very quick to make you feel at home. We arrived at 2 o'clock, thinking we would miss the lunch rush but they remained busy during the length of our stay. 
We witnessed many repeat clients being welcomed warmly like old friends and we knew that we had discovered a local secret!

After ordering we were served traditional bread & flavoured oil. (Delicious!). We tried a variety of starters, hummus (creamy), cucumber yogurt dip (devine), and the feta filo pastry cigars that were served with spicy dipping sauce (I could have eaten a dozen of them!).

Our mains were the adana (spicy) lamb kebab, lamb kofte (meatballs) and the lamb pide (pizza). The first two were served with rice and salad. 
The salads were made from fresh ingredients and the meat was tender, well seasoned and ridiculously tasty! 

We can't wait to come back and try some new items from the menu, and remember to leave some room for dessert!

data.title: Amazing food
data.text: We've been here several and have taken out of town guests as well.  The food is delicious.  We tried the fried eggplant, it was scrumptious.  I tried the pepperoni pide, but as I had the feta cheese with egg on a previous visit I asked for the egg to be included.  The staff were very accommodating.  Everything was delicious. For Friday dinner, I would recommend booking in advance as they get really busy and most often there is always a wait for a table.

data.title: Hidden gem in Cary
data.text: Delicious food, good service, nice decor.   Hidden gem in Cary -newly renovated.  Authentic Turkish food.  Started off with the fresh pita bread and flavored oil.  Yum!  Had a mixed plate of meats - the Adana was my favorite but they were all good.  Waiter was gracious.   Will definitely go back.

data.title: Consistently excellent
data.text: Easily the best middle eastern food in Wake County.  Each of the Shish Kabobs are very good as are the grape leaves.

data.title: Love love love this place
data.text: Great food, and home to truly the best most friendly and helpful waiter ever.  Their hummus if the best we have ever had.

data.title: Escellent food, but pick your time
data.text: We have been to Bosphorus twice and both time the food was excellent and the selection above average.  The small app and included hot tea were very nice touches.  The first time we went, the reservation system was chaotic and we had to wait over twenty minutes after our time.  The second visit, we arrived earlier and the system seemed better managed.

data.title: Great service!
data.text: The service was great, very attentive staff, and the food was wonderful.  The food was prepared fresh and was very inexpensive.  Four of us ate for less than $80 (including tip) and we had two appetizers!  We will certainly return the next time we are in the area.

data.title: Still ourstanding
data.text: Best Turkish food in the area. Five of us for dinner on a Friday night. My wife & I eat there often but our guests have only been a few times. We are recognized as soon as we go in and are seated immediately. Food here is always great. My problem is I tend to order the same thing all the time. Not so with the rest of our party. They are always trying something different. I get Sauteed Liver and Adana Kabob. Great! We always have hot tea and baklava at the end. They do not have a liquor license but you are welcome to bring in your own wine or beer. No charges involved. They doubled the seating area early this year by taking over the empty store front next door. next step will be to expand the kitchen to match. We always manage to get there outside the rush so the wait for our food is never very long.

data.title: One of our Favorite Places in Cary, NC
data.text: The food here is always so fresh and a small quaint atmosphere.  I really like that the staff is very welcoming and we can bring in our own beer or wine since they don't serve alcohol.  They don't charge a cork fee and happy if you bring your own.

data.title: Excellent service and fresh, quality food
data.text: This was the perfect afternoon lunch spot for my mother-in-law, my daughter (14 months), and myself. We were welcomed and greeted with smiles. My mother-in-law eats at this place often and they know her here. We ordered appetizers - falafel and hummus - and my daughter loved it! The gyro sandwiches were also fantastic. I loved the Turkish tea - hot and strong!

data.title: First and excellent experience
data.text: First time at a Turkish restaurant, and impressed. Great staff with friendly and prompt service. Food tastes and looks amazing. Perfect for a family or friends night out.

data.title: Real Turkish food in Central NC
data.text: My wife's parents came from Turkey so she was able to eat all the goodies, her Grandma used to make. The waiters spot any person with a trace of Turkish or Mediterranean blood when you walk in. We started with the Appetizers  inc Hummus, a yogurt dish & dishes I can't name except they were wrapped in a flaky light dough & contained meat or spinach or cheese or veggies inside. Then we had Kabobs with great rice  & salad. My Kabob was for garlic lovers & contained 3 delicious lamb patties & 3 great beef patties. We took so long to eat lunch they ran out of baklava so we have to go back. We did finish the meal with delicious Turkish coffee. It is so exciting to go to a true International ethnic restaurant without having to go to NY. That Raleigh has his restaurant is a symbol of it's diverse growth in the Triangle area

data.title: Excellent Mediterranean food, not fancy decor
data.text: Just a storefront from the outside, and very casual inside, but it has Excellent Mediterranean food, and generous portions if not a fancy decor. The restaurant does not have a liquor license but allows you to bring your own bottle/beverage.

data.title: Great Food
data.text: Loved the kabobs, salad and falafel. Probably the best I've had in the Triangle area. Service was pleasant but a little light. I do not care for the location due to the strip mall/bar surroundings but I would certainly recommend their food!

data.title: Excellent Turkish/Mediterranean food in a small busy restaurant
data.text: It is a small restaurant, but busy enough that they needed to expand in the last year. A very nice choice of meat and vegetarian dishes, with a lot of very nice appetizers.

data.title: Will always be back
data.text: Second time back, and it's a must-eat any time we visit the area.  Really excellent service, with the warmest of welcomes when you enter the door.  We learned to bring our own wine, and we are always cheerfully provided glasses (don't worry about what kind of glasses) and an opener.  Twice we had the cold platter, and enjoyed all the salads and spreads.  A second basket of pita was brought, without us asking, for the remainder of the platter.  On this visit, we both had the Pidde pizzas.  My husband had the lamb one, and liked it just fine.  I'm not a lamb lover but my feta and tomato pidde was great.  All the customers seemed to be having a  great time, and all the staff were very attentive and friendly.  It almost felt like a private family party, except we didn't know anyone!

data.title: Turkish food at its best.
data.text: Enjoyed it throughly. The owners have bought a part of Turkey in their hearts which reflects in the food and hospitality

data.title: Some of the best greek/med in the Cary/Apex area
data.text: Great food at great prices.  Better than other "chain" mediterranean restaurantes in the area, and with more generous servings.
